item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Flapple & Appletun
item.description:
Pokemon GO Sweet Discoveries 2025 event released Applin, Flapple, and Appletun. You must first catch Applin and evolve it into either Flapple or Appletun. But, there are certain must-have items to complete the evolution process.

Applin debuted in Pokemon GO on April 24, 2025, Sweet Discoveries event. You can encounter Applin in the wild, by tapping on Apples, or by completing specific Research tasks. Applin can evolve into Flapple or Appletun, so you must have two Applins to get both evolutions. You need numerous Apple and Applin Candies to get both of its evolution. That said, this guide details how to evolve Applin and get Flapple and Appletun in the game.

How to Evolve Applin In Pokemon GO?

Once you catch an Applin, you can proceed to evolve it. You can either evolve Applin into a Flapple or an Appletun; both are Grass and Dragon-type Pokemon. They share the same evolution requirements, which are Applin Candies and Pokemon GO Apples. While you can get Applin Candies by catching/transferring numerous Applin, the in-game Apples only appear during specific events.

How To Get Apples In Pokemon GO?

The Pokemon GO 2025 Sweet Discoveries event debuts Applin and the new in-game item, Apple. You can get Apples scattered around on the map and tapping on them offers rewards. You can also get Apples by completing specific Research tasks during featured events. The rewards include an Applin encounter, Sweet Apple, or Tart Apples.

There is also a possibility of Paras, Cottonee, or their Shiny counterparts spawning instead of an Applin.

How To Get Flapple In Pokemon GO?

You can get a Flapple in Pokemon GO by evolving Applin. The requirement is 20 Sweet Apples and 200 Applin Candies .

Flapple Pokemon GO Stats

  • Maximum Combat Power: 2788 CP
  • Attack Stat: 214 ATK
  • Defense Stat: 144 DEF
  • Stamina Stat: 172 HP

Pokemon GO: Is Shiny Flapple Available?

No, you cannot get a Shiny Flapple in Pokemon GO . The game developers have yet to release the monsterâ€™s Shiny variant in the game.

How To Get Appletun In Pokemon GO?

You can get an Appletun in Pokemon GO by evolving Applin. The requirement is 20 Tart Apples and 200 Applin Candies .

Appletun Pokemon GO Stats

  • Maximum Combat Power: 2772 CP
  • Attack Stat: 178 ATK
  • Defense Stat: 146 DEF
  • Stamina Stat: 242 HP

Pokemon GO: Is Shiny Appletun Available?

No, Shiny Appletun isnâ€™t available to catch in Pokemon GO . The developers rarely release a Shiny variant along with its Standard counterpart. The Shiny Pokemon might debut in future events featuring Applin.

item.title: What If... Destiny 2's Gambit Was a Hit?
item.description:
Summary

  • Destiny 2 could've built seasonal content around Gambit, introducing new maps, objectives, and boss modifiers each season.
  • The Drifter might have stepped into the spotlight, offering moral ambiguity and branching questlines tied to Gambit.
  • Regular map updates and experimental modes could have kept Gambit fresh, featuring sudden-death rounds and 3v3 matches.

When Destiny 2 's Forsaken expansion introduced Gambit, it felt like Bungie was really onto something. As a mode that fused wave-based PvE with intense PvP invasions, Gambit was messy, chaotic, and unlike anything else in the game. For all intents and purposes, it was the perfect counterweight to Destiny 2 's increasingly weary Vanguard and Crucible content. As a result â€” for a moment at least â€” Gambit was a promise that suggested Destiny 2 might be headed toward a brighter future.

Unfortunately, that's not the timeline Destiny 2 's Gambit ended up in. In reality, Gambit slowly fizzled out and ended up on life support, where it merely survived until it became all but irrelevant. Still, it's hard not to wonder what it might have been if it had turned out to be a hit. If Gambit had succeeded and achieved what it set out to do, what kind of Destiny 2 would players be logging into today? What kinds of stories, systems, and support would have emerged from an innovative mode that actually lived up to its potential?

What Destiny 2's Gambit Might Have Been

Destiny 2 Might Have Built Themed Seasonal Content Around Gambit

If Gambit had taken off the way it presumably hoped, it's likely that Destiny 2 might have started building full seasonal frameworks around it. This wouldn't involve simply reusing it as a playlist, but making it a significant part of major content drops. Perhaps seasonal enemies might have been designed with PvEvP mechanics in mind, while new maps could have been linked to each season's story â€” like Hive-themed maps during Season of the Witch, or Europa-based maps that implemented Stasis as either a buff or a hindrance for players to navigate. More than that, Gambit could've introduced rotating objectives and boss modifiers to keep the mode feeling fresh with each season, especially since a major part of its downfall was its repetitive nature.

Destiny 2's Drifter Might Have Taken Center Stage as a Narrative Counterbalance

If Destiny 2 's Gambit had found the success it aimed for, maybe the Drifter would have emerged from the shadows to become a central narrative figure in the way of being a full-blown foil to Commander Zavala and the Vanguard. Destiny 2 could have really leaned into the conflict between Light and Dark by making the Drifter its primary voice for moral ambiguity, to the point of offering players choices that challenged their own morals by blurring the lines of what it meant to be a Guardian. Seasonal storylines could have even featured branching quests tied to this idea, as it sure seemed like the game wanted to do that much initially.

The Drifter did play a significant role in Destiny 2 's Season of the Drifter, where he led players through morally ambiguous quests linked to Gambit Prime, the mysterious Nine, and his past. Unfortunately, that's about as far as his relevance to Destiny 2 's overarching story went.

Gambit Might Have Received Regular Map and Mode Updates

In a world where Gambit was a hit, Destiny 2 might have given it the same treatment it had given the Vanguard and Crucible playlists up to the point of its introduction. This might have meant regular map rotations, new mechancis, and more experimental modes like Gambit Prime. Instead of playing the same maps for years, players might have seen seasonal arenas tied to new destinations, like a Strand-based map on Neomuna or a Taken zone in Destiny 2 's Pale Heart. Additionally, Gambit could have even occasionally introduced new rules, like sudden-death boss rounds, public events mid-match, or even 3v3 Gambit matches that increased the challenge.

If Gambit had taken off the way it presumably hoped, it's likely that Destiny 2 might have started building full seasonal frameworks around it.

Ultimately, the fall of Destiny 2 's Gambit was more the loss of a bigger idea than a unique game mode. The hybrid format might have changed how players approached combat, morality, and seasonal content in Destiny 2 . While it never quite got the support it needed in order to truly succeed, the pieces were all there â€” and it could be argued that they still are. Maybe Destiny 2 's Gambit was ahead of its time. Maybe it asked too much of a community that was already showing signs of splitting. However, in another timeline, maybe Gambit isn't the forgotten third option on the Tower screen but is instead the one thing that holds it all together.

item.title: Another Crab's Treasure is a Far Better Game - 365 Days Later
item.description: Another Crab's Treasure is one year old! While it was an excellent game at launch a year down the line it has become far better. Join us today as we talk about the first year of Another Crab's Treasure.

item.title: The Sims 4 Laundry List Reveals Major Fixes Arriving in Next Update
item.description:
Summary

  • The Sims 4's Laundry List details major fixes being investigated for the next update.
  • Based on community concerns, some of the issues being looked at include glitching Vampire eyes and game freezes.

Electronic Arts has released a brand-new Laundry List for The Sims 4 players, highlighting major fixes that are being investigated for the social simâ€™s next update, and these fixes are in response to a long list of community concerns. The Sims 4 has been on the market for over a decade, and in its longevity, it has released several DLC packs designed to add new features, objects, and worlds, including the recent Businesses & Hobbies pack.

The Sims 4 players were treated to a surprise update at the start of April, and many believe this was a calculated effort to combat the release of competitor sim InZOIâ€™s late-March launch. Nevertheless, the update boasted a variety of new items and character customization options for fans to jump on.

Since The Sims 4 is one of the best games that lets players grow their own garden, some of the top fixes being investigated for the next update are a bug that stops Sims from being able to water plants and plants that show black spots after zooming out. Other leading community concerns aired in the Laundry List include glitching Vampire eyes on Child Sims, unresponsive Sims and game freeze while using the save menu, and a bug that renders the game unresponsive when traveling to the Library and the Willow Creek nightclub. Another more bizarre issue being investigated is a problem with Simsâ€™ arm hair not being removed after shaving to the playerâ€™s preferred length.

The Sims 4 Laundry List Specifies Fixes Coming in Next Update Based on Community Concerns

The life sim community isnâ€™t shy about making its voice heard regarding in-game issues, including The Sims 4 player baseâ€™s annoyance with one particular object. Thanks to the gameâ€™s forum, Maxis and EA have been monitoring playersâ€™ concerns, which has seemingly been the driving force behind a chunk of the next updateâ€™s fixes. Furthermore, the Laundry List noted some more topics reported by players didnâ€™t make the list, but they were still being worked on behind the scenes.

The Sims 4 has been the leading social sim since it broke onto the scene, but the gaming community had another life simulation game on their radar recently. Publisher Kraftonâ€™s InZOI was considered to be somewhat of a threat to Maxis and EAâ€™s flagship IP, so much so that the publisher sent The Sims 4 players surveys regarding InZOI . Since the new life sim is still in early access, itâ€™s evident the devs still have some bugs to eradicate, and the 85% drop in player count after launch will be continuously monitored as well.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How to Complete Books With No Pictures (Alice Level 2 Friendship Quest)
item.description:
After unlocking and welcoming Alice to Disney Dreamlight Valley , you can begin to progress through her Friendship Quests, with the first being all about books and a different type of magic. Alice's level 2 Friendship quest, Books with No Pictures , takes you on an adventure across the Valley to find the missing words that mysteriously escaped from one of Merlin's books. The quest also sees you make a cozy reading space for Alice and her new-found friend Vanellope, including a quirky pop-up book.

However, as things get more curious, there are many steps to completing Books with No Pictures in Disney Dreamlight Valley , and you might wonder how to find the various missing Magical Words. There are also a few requirements that must be met in order to start the Books with No Pictures quest, which gives you 440 Friendship Points with Alice on completion.

How to Complete Books With No Pictures in Disney Dreamlight Valley (Alice Level 2 Friendship Quest)

How to Start Books With No Pictures

To start Books with No Pictures in Disney Dreamlight Valley , you must first complete all four Wonderland Realm quests and welcome Alice to the Valley . You can begin Books with No Pictures when you reach level 2 Friendship with Alice , such as by giving her gifts like flowers, gems, or her favorite things of the day, plus meet the following quest unlock requirements:

  • Unlock Vanellope , Ursula , Remy , and Mirabel as characters in Disney Dreamlight Valley .
  • Unlock the Dazzle Beach biome .

After reaching level 2 Friendship with Alice and meeting all of the above requirements, you can select the Books with No Pictures dialogue option when speaking with Alice to get started. She will then tell you that she'd like your help introducing Vanellope to picture books.

Speak With Vanellope About Hanging Out With Alice and Go Inside the Dreamlight Library

The first objective in Books with No Pictures is to speak with Vanellope about hanging out with Alice for some reading. While it's not video game-related, Vanellope agrees. After chatting with Vanellope, head inside Merlin's Dreamlight Library and speak with Alice and Vanellope , who are waiting there. However, things soon start getting a bit strange when Vanellope starts reading one of the books on the table, with the words leaping off the pages and running wild.

Talk to Scrooge McDuck or Mickey Mouse and Goofy

The next step is to ask Scrooge, Mickey, or Goofy about the missing Magical Nouns from the book, otherwise known as naming words. It seems you can ask any character you like, but if you speak with Scrooge first, he tells you Goofy fished up something odd from one of the ponds - one of the strangest fish Goofy has ever seen. Chat with Goofy , and he will give you the Magical Noun 'House' attached to a fish, but you'll need to fish up the rest.

Find Some Magical Nouns From Ponds in the Peaceful Meadow and Talk to Alice

Next, you need to catch two more Magical Nouns with your Royal Fishing Rod from the ponds in the Peaceful Meadow - the ' NOUN: Shoe ' and ' NOUN: Card .' Doing so gives you three Magical Nouns altogether with the one Goofy gave you.

You can spot the Magical Nouns in ponds by the large blue and purple bubbles with blue letters . Afterward, speak to Alice again to give her the Magical Nouns, but you've also got some missing Magic Verbs to find.

Search For and Chase After the Magic Verbs in the Plaza, Then Catch Them in the Dreamlight Castle

Head to the Plaza to search for the missing three Magic Verbs, which you can find by chasing a white rabbit with the blue letter trail into the Dream Castle. There are three rabbits to catch inside the Castle to get the Magic Verbs, and they are pretty fast. That said, you can grab them by quickly interacting with them when they briefly change direction, learning their movement paths, using a glider, or increasing your energy.

Once you've caught all three Magic Verbs, which are 'grow,' 'stuck,' and 'skip,' give them to Alice by talking to her again . She then tells you a bit more about what adjectives do and suggests looking for the missing Magical Adjectives and searching around fruit trees and shrubs.

Search the Valley For Magical Adjectives and Gather Them

You can find the Magical Adjectives on berry bushes in the Plaza , Peaceful Meadow , or Dazzle Beach . Interact with the bushes to collect the Magical Adjectives. However, you can only gather two, and it seems the third is missing.

Talk to Remy, Ursula, or Mirabel About the Missing Magical Adjectives and Search Mickey's House

At this point in Books with No Pictures, you can choose whether to speak with Remy , Ursula , or Mirabel about the Missing Magical Adjectives. If you talk to Remy, he talks about the Magical Adjectives in cooking and suggests checking inside Mickey's House. Head inside Mickey's house to find the last Magical Adjective on the fridge , which you can collect.

Bring the Magical Adjectives to Alice and Read Her Silly Poetry to Merlin

Speak to Alice again to give her the three Magical Adjectives: 'Striped,' 'Verdant,' and 'Silly.' She'll ask you to pick some of the words so she can make up a bit of silly poetry, so feel free to choose any ones you like.

Next, follow Alice and listen to her read the poem to Merlin , who seems to enjoy it a lot, then talk to him . It turns out that there's a bit more to the Magical Words than meets the eye, and Merlin suggests that you make a Literary Pop-Up Book for the words and Alice to enjoy spending time together.

Gather Materials to Craft the Literary Pop-Up Book

Next up, you'll need to grab the following materials to craft the Literary Pop-Up Book:

  • x4 Sunflower - found growing at Dazzle Beach .
  • x5 Pink Hydrangea - found growing at Dazzle Beach .
  • x9 Softwood - found on the ground in the Plaza , Peaceful Meadow , Forest of Valor , Glade of Trust , and Ancient's Landing .
  • x12 Fiber - crafted from Seaweed at a crafting station.

Once you've gathered all the materials above, craft the Literary Pop-Up Book in the Furniture tab at a crafting station.

Talk to Alice and Make a Cozy Reading Room in Your House

Return to Alice, who wants to introduce Vanellope to the Pop-Up Book but wants you to set the scene by making a cozy library space . To do so, you'll need to already have or add the following furniture items to any room in your house using the furniture menu:

  • The Literary Pop-Up Book you crafted
  • A rug
  • A table
  • Two lights
  • At least three calm furniture items

You can use any existing room in your house to make a cozy reading room, and you don't need to expand to make a new room unless you would prefer to. If you need more furniture pieces, such as calm furniture, you could order and buy more from Scrooge's store if necessary. Selecting items from the requests tab under the Alice icons can also help you choose the right furniture if you're stuck.

Afterward, speak with Alice again, who will ask you to choose any words you like for another poem to read. Doing so completes the Books with No Pictures quest, and Alice also gives you the Literary Pop-Up Book as a gift.

You can now continue leveling up your friendship with Alice to begin her next quest, 'Mimsy Were the Borogoves,' where things get even more puzzling.
